text: おはようシンジ君 / 調子はどう? / 慣れました / 悪くないと思います / それは結構 / エヴァの出現位置 / 非常用電源 / 並走ビルの配置 / 回収スポット
translation: Good morning, Shinji. / How are you doing? / I've gotten used to it. / I think it's not bad. / That's good. / Eva's deployment position / Emergency power supply / Parallel building arrangement / Recovery spot

vocabulary.meaning: condition, state, how things are going
to get used to, to become accustomed

grammar: ました form indicates completed action (慣れました = 'have gotten used to'); と思います is a pattern meaning 'I think that...'; それは結構 is a set phrase meaning 'that's good/fine'

text: 全部頭に入っているわね / 多分 / ではもう一度おさらいするわ
translation: You've got it all in your head, haven't you? / Probably. / Well then, let's review it one more time.

vocabulary.meaning: to memorize, to get into one's head

grammar: ているわね uses the continuous form ている + feminine ending わね for confirmation; では marks transition to new action; するわ is feminine form of する

text: 通常エヴァは有線からの電力供給で稼働しています
translation: Normally, Eva operates on power supplied through cables.
grammar: からの indicates source (from cables); で marks means/method; しています is polite continuous form indicating ongoing state

text: 非常時に体内電池に切り替えると / 蓄電容量の関係でフルで1分
translation: When switching to the internal battery in an emergency, / due to storage capacity limitations, it's one minute at full power.
grammar: に marks point in time (非常時に = in an emergency); と conditional form (切り替えると = when you switch); の関係で means 'due to/because of'; で indicates state/condition

text: ゲインを利用してもせいぜい5分しか稼働できないの
translation: Even using the gain, it can only operate for 5 minutes at most.
grammar: ても form means 'even if/even when'; しか + negative (できない) creates 'only' meaning; の at end is feminine explanatory particle

text: これが私たちの科学の限界ってわけ / お分かりね / はい
translation: This is the limit of our science, you see. / You understand, right? / Yes.
grammar: ってわけ is casual form of というわけ meaning 'it means that/you see'; お分かりね uses honorific prefix お + わかり + confirmation particle ね

text: では昨日の続きインダクションモード始めるわよ
translation: Well then, let's start the induction mode, continuing from yesterday.
grammar: では marks transition; の connects nouns (昨日の続き = yesterday's continuation); わよ is feminine assertive ending

text: 目標をセンターに入れて / スイッチオン
translation: Put the target in the center / Switch on.
grammar: を marks direct object; に marks destination/location; て form (入れて) indicates sequential action

text: 落ち着いて目標をセンターに / ピッチ
translation: Calm down, put the target in the center / Pitch.

vocabulary.meaning: to calm down, to settle down

grammar: て form (落ち着いて) used as imperative to give instruction; can mean 'calm down and...'

text: 次
translation: Next.
grammar: Simple noun used as command/instruction

text: しかしよく呪気になってくれましたねシンジ君
translation: However, you've really settled in well, haven't you, Shinji?

vocabulary.meaning: to settle in, to get accustomed (likely meant to be 熟気/familiar)

grammar: てくれました shows appreciation for action done for speaker's benefit; ね is seeking confirmation/agreement

text: 人の言うことにはおとなしく従う / それがあの子の書生術じゃないの?
translation: He obediently follows what people say. / That's his survival technique, isn't it?
grammar: には emphasizes topic; じゃないの is casual form of ではないの (feminine) meaning 'isn't it?'

text: ねえ、美里さん、もう朝なんですけど
translation: Hey, Misato-san, it's already morning.
grammar: なんです is explanatory form; けど is 'but' used to soften statement or imply unspoken continuation

text: さっきまで到着だったの / 今日は夕方までに出頭すればいいの / だから寝かせて / じゃ、僕 / 今日木曜日だっけ?
translation: I just got in a moment ago. / Today I just need to report by evening. / So let me sleep. / Well then, I'm off. / Today's Thursday, right?
grammar: まで indicates extent/up to; までに means 'by (time)'; すればいい means 'it's fine if I do/just need to do'; だから means 'therefore/so'; だっけ seeks confirmation about memory

text: マイルゴミお願いね
translation: Please take out the burnable trash.
grammar: お願いね is casual request form with ね for gentle emphasis

text: はい / 学校の方はもう慣れた?
translation: Okay. / Have you gotten used to school yet?
grammar: の方 softens the topic, like 'as for school'; もう means 'already/yet'; past tense た in question form asks about completed state

text: ええ / 行ってらっしゃい / 行ってきます
translation: Yes. / See you later. / I'm off.

vocabulary.meaning: see you later (said to someone leaving)

grammar: These are set phrases for leaving/seeing someone off; てらっしゃい combines て form + いらっしゃい; てきます combines て form + きます (go and come back)

text: はい / もしもし
translation: Yes? / Hello?
grammar: はい used to answer phone; もしもし is standard phone greeting

text: なんだリツコか / どう? / 彼氏とはうまくいってる? / 彼?
translation: Oh, it's you, Ritsuko. / How are things? / Are things going well with your boyfriend? / Boyfriend?
grammar: なんだ expresses recognition; か marks question; とは marks topic with emphasis; ている indicates ongoing state; contracted てる is casual

text: シンジ君ね / 転校して2週間相変わらずよ。
translation: You mean Shinji. / It's been two weeks since he transferred, and he's still the same.

vocabulary.meaning: as always, unchanged, still the same

grammar: ね confirms/clarifies; して indicates action and time passage; 2週間 marks duration; よ is feminine assertive particle

text: 未だに誰からも電話かかってこないのよね。 / 電話?
translation: He still hasn't gotten any calls from anyone. / Calls?

vocabulary.meaning: to come in, to be received (for calls)

grammar: からも with negative = 'from anyone'; てこない means 'hasn't come'; のよね combines explanatory の + feminine よ + confirmation ね

text: 必須アイテムだからずいぶん前に携帯渡したんだけどね。
translation: Since it's an essential item, I gave him a cell phone quite a while ago.
grammar: だから means 'because/so'; に marks point in time; んだけどね combines explanatory んだ + けど (but) + ね; implies unspoken continuation

text: 自分で使ったり、誰からもかかってきた様子ないのよ。
translation: There's no sign of him using it himself or getting calls from anyone.
grammar: たり pattern lists examples; かかってきた is past form of かかってくる (to come in); 様子ない means 'no sign of'; のよ is feminine explanatory + assertive

text: あいつ、ひょっとして友達いないんじゃないかしら。 / シンジ君ってどうも友達を作るのには不向きな性格かもしれないよね。
translation: I wonder if maybe he doesn't have any friends. / Shinji's personality might not really be suited for making friends, you know.
grammar: んじゃないかしら combines explanatory ん + じゃない (negative) + かしら (feminine wondering); って marks topic casually; のには marks purpose/for doing; かもしれない means 'might be'

text: 山嵐のジレンマって話知ってる? / 山嵐? / あのトゲトゲの / 山嵐の場合相手に自分の温もりを伝えたいと思っても
translation: Do you know the story about the hedgehog's dilemma? / Hedgehog? / Those spiky things? / In the hedgehog's case, even if they want to convey their warmth to another,
grammar: って marks topic/quotation casually; ている in 知ってる is contracted て form asking about state; の nominalizes トゲトゲ; たいと思っても means 'even if/though one wants to'

text: 身を寄せれば寄せるほど体中のトゲでお互いを傷つけてしまう / 人間にも同じことが言えるわ
translation: The closer they get to each other, the more they hurt each other with the spines all over their bodies. The same can be said of humans.

vocabulary.meaning: to draw close, to get near to someone
all over one's body, throughout the body
to hurt, to injure, to wound
can be said, to be able to say

grammar: ば conditional form + same verb in conditional = 'the more... the more' pattern (寄せれば寄せるほど). しまう after a verb indicates an undesirable result. 同じことが言える is a set phrase meaning 'the same can be said.'

text: 今のシンジ君は心のどこかで / 痛みに怯えて臆病になってるんでしょうね
translation: Right now, somewhere in his heart, Shinji is probably afraid of the pain and has become timid.

vocabulary.meaning: to be frightened, to be scared

grammar: て-form connecting two actions (怯えて). なっている indicates a current state. んでしょうね is の + でしょう (conjecture) + ね (confirmation-seeking), showing soft speculation.

text: ま、そのうち気づくわよ / 大人になるってことは近づいたり離れたりを繰り返して
translation: Well, he'll realize eventually. Becoming an adult means repeating getting close and pulling away.
grammar: ってことは (colloquial for ということは) means 'means that.' たり...たり pattern lists alternative actions. を after the たり pattern makes it the object of 繰り返す.

text: お互いがあまり傷つかずに済む距離を見つけ出すってことに
translation: Finding a distance where they won't hurt each other too much.

vocabulary.meaning: not very much, not too much (with negative)
to be hurt, to be injured
to get by, to manage, to be sufficient

grammar: ずに (negative て-form) + 済む means 'to manage without doing.' ってことに continues the definition of 'becoming an adult' from the previous segment.

text: 第2話 スタッフ / 第3話 スタッフ
translation: Episode 2 Staff / Episode 3 Staff
grammar: Episode credits announcement. 第 + counter indicates ordinal numbers.

text: 何、委員長? / 昨日のプリント届けてくれた? / え、 / ああ、ああ、いや、なんか当時のうち、留守みたいでさ。
translation: What is it, class rep? Did you deliver yesterday's handout? Huh? Oh, yeah, no, it seems like Toji's house was empty or something.

vocabulary.meaning: Toji (name, though 当時 normally means 'that time')

grammar: てくれた is て-form + くれる (to do for me) in past tense. みたいで means 'it seemed like.' さ is a casual sentence-ending particle.

text: 相田君、鈴原と仁いいんでしょ? / 2週間も休んで心配じゃないの? / 大けがでもしたのかな? / え? / 例のロボット事件で? / テレビじゃ一人もいなかったって / ま
translation: Aida, you're good friends with Suzuhara, right? Isn't it worrying that he's been absent for two weeks? I wonder if he got seriously injured? Huh? In that robot incident? The TV said there were no casualties... Well...
grammar: んでしょ is んです (explanatory) + でしょう (conjecture). じゃないの is 'isn't it?' でも after noun means 'or something.' のかな shows wondering. って quotative particle. も with negative means 'not even one.'

text: さか、鷹之山の爆心地見たろ?
translation: Come on, you saw the ground zero at Takanosu, right?
grammar: ろ is Kansai dialect for だろう (right?/isn't it?)

text: イルマや小松だけじゃなくて / 三沢や九州の部隊まで出動してんだよ / 絶対10人や20人じゃ済まないよ / 死人だって
translation: Not just Iruma and Komatsu, but even the units from Misawa and Kyushu were deployed. There's no way it was just 10 or 20 people. Even deaths...

vocabulary.meaning: to be finished with, to get by with

grammar: や lists examples. だけじゃなくて means 'not only but also.' まで means 'even.' してんだ is colloquial している + explanatory の. じゃ済まない means 'can't be settled with just.' だって means 'even.'

text: 当時? / 鈴原
translation: Toji? Suzuhara.
grammar: Simple name calling/identification.

text: なんや、ずいぶん減ったみたいやな / 疎開だよ、疎開 / みんな転校しちゃったよ
translation: What's this, looks like there are a lot fewer people. It's evacuation, evacuation. Everyone transferred schools.
grammar: みたいやな is Kansai dialect for みたいだね (seems like). ちゃった is colloquial てしまった (ended up doing), indicating completion with slight regret.

text: 街中であれだけ派手に戦争されちゃうね / 喜んどんなお前だけやろな / 生のドンパチ見れるよってに
translation: When they have such a flashy battle in the middle of the city... You're probably the only one who's happy about it. Because you get to see real combat.

vocabulary.meaning: to be pleased, to be glad

grammar: されちゃう is passive される + ちゃう (colloquial てしまう). 喜んどん is Kansai for 喜んでいる. やろな is Kansai for だろうね. よってに is Kansai for から (because).

text: まあね当時はどうしてたのこんなに休んじゃってさ
translation: Well yeah. Toji, what were you doing, being absent for so long?
grammar: こんなに means 'so much/this much.' 休んじゃって is 休んでしまって (ended up being absent). さ is a casual ending particle.

text: この間の騒ぎで巻き添えでも食ったの / 妹のやつがな
translation: Did you get caught up in that recent commotion or something? Well, my sister...
grammar: でも means 'or something.' 食った is past tense of 食う. な is a sentence-ending particle (Kansai) for emphasis.

text: 妹のやつがガルギの下敷きになってもうて
translation: My sister got crushed under the rubble.

vocabulary.meaning: to be crushed under, to be pinned under

grammar: になってもうて is Kansai dialect for になってしまって (ended up becoming). もうて is the Kansai version of しまって.

text: 命は助かったけどずっと入院しとんねん / うちんとこ、おとんもおじいも研究所すとめやろ? / 今、職場を離れるわけにはいかんしな。
translation: Her life was saved, but she's been hospitalized ever since. At my place, both my dad and grandpa work at the research institute, right? Right now they can't leave their workplace.

vocabulary.meaning: to be saved, to be rescued

grammar: しとんねん is Kansai for している + explanatory の. うちんとこ = うちのところ. すとめ is Kansai for 勤め (employment). やろ is Kansai for だろう. わけにはいかん is わけにはいかない (cannot possibly do).

text: 俺がおらんと、あいつ病院で一人になってまうからな。
translation: If I'm not there, she'll be all alone at the hospital.

vocabulary.meaning: to be (Kansai dialect for いる)

grammar: おらんと is Kansai for いないと (if not). なってまう is Kansai for なってしまう (end up becoming). からな is explanatory から + emphasis な.

text: しかし、あのロボットのパイロットはほんまにヘボやな。 / むちゃくちゃ腹立つわ。
translation: But that robot's pilot is really incompetent. It's incredibly frustrating.

vocabulary.meaning: to get angry, to be irritated

grammar: ほんまに is Kansai for 本当に. やな is Kansai for だね. わ is Kansai sentence-ending particle for emphasis.

text: 味方が暴れて、どないするってんじゃん。 / それなんだけど、聞いた?転校生の噂。 / 転校 / 生? / ほら、あいつ。
translation: What's the point if our allies are rampaging? Speaking of which, did you hear? The rumor about the transfer student. Transfer student? Look, that guy.
grammar: どないする is Kansai for どうする. ってんじゃん is って言うんじゃない (isn't it that...). それなんだけど means 'speaking of that.' 聞いた? is casual past tense question.

text: 当時が休んでいる間に 転入してきた奴なんだけど / あの事件の後にだよ 変だと思わない?
translation: He's the guy who transferred in while Toji was absent. It was right after that incident. Don't you think that's weird?
grammar: 間に means 'while, during.' てきた indicates movement toward the speaker. なんだけど is explanatory の + けど (but). だよ adds emphasis. と思わない means 'don't you think?'

text: キリッ!
translation: *bell rings*
grammar: Onomatopoeia for a school bell.

text: ああ このように人類は その最大の試練を迎えたのであります
translation: Yes, and thus humanity faced its greatest trial.

vocabulary.meaning: to face, to meet, to greet

grammar: のであります is formal copula, typical of lectures or formal speeches. を迎える means 'to face/encounter.'

text: 20世紀最後の年 宇宙より飛来した大質量の隕石が南極に衝突 / 氷の大陸を一緒にして誘拐させたのであります
translation: In the last year of the 20th century, a massive meteorite that came from space collided with the Antarctic, completely vaporizing the continent of ice.

vocabulary.meaning: should be 融解 (ゆうかい) - melting, vaporization

grammar: より indicates source/origin. した is past tense modifier. を一緒にして likely means 'entirely/completely.' させた is causative past tense.

text: 海洋の水位は上昇し地軸も曲がり
translation: The ocean's water level rose and the Earth's axis shifted.
grammar: し-form (continuative) connects sequential actions. も means 'also.'

text: 生物の存在をも脅かす異常気象が / 世界中を / 襲いました
translation: Abnormal weather that threatened the very existence of living things struck the entire world.
grammar: をも is emphatic を, meaning 'even.' が marks the subject. を marks the object. ました is polite past tense.

text: そして数千種の生物とともに / 人類の半分が永遠に失われたのであります / これが世に言うセカンドインパクトであります
translation: And along with thousands of species of life, half of humanity was lost forever. This is what is known as the Second Impact.

vocabulary.meaning: what is known as, what is called

grammar: ~とともに (together with); passive form 失われた (was lost); formal であります ending for formal speech

text: 経済の崩壊、民族紛争、内戦 / その後生き残った人々もありふたけの地獄を見ました
translation: Economic collapse, ethnic conflicts, civil war... even those people who survived afterwards saw every kind of hell imaginable.
grammar: ~た past tense modifier (生き残った人々 = people who survived); particle も (even); ありったけの (all/every kind of)

text: だがあれから15年 / わずか15年で私たちはここまで復興を遂げることができたのです
translation: But 15 years since then... in just 15 years we were able to accomplish this level of reconstruction.
grammar: ~で (in/within time period); ことができた (was able to do); のです explanatory ending

text: これは私たち人類の優秀性もさることながら
translation: While this is certainly due to the excellence of us humans...

vocabulary.meaning: while...is certainly true, not only...but also

grammar: もさることながら (while...is true; not only...but also) - a set phrase used to acknowledge one factor while introducing another

text: 皆さんのお父さんお母さんの血と汗と涙と努力の賜物と言えるでありましょう
translation: It can be said to be the result of your fathers' and mothers' blood, sweat, tears, and effort.
grammar: と conjunction connecting nouns (blood and sweat and tears and effort); と言える (can be said to be); でありましょう formal/archaic copula + conjecture

text: その頃私は眠川に住んでましてね / 今はもう / ちょっとみんな / まだ授業中でしょ / 席についてください / またそうやってすぐに仕切る / いいじゃんいいじゃん
translation: At that time I was living in Nemukawa... Now it's already... Hey everyone, class is still in session, right? Please take your seats. There you go again, taking charge right away. It's fine, it's fine.
grammar: ~ていまして polite continuative form; でしょ casual form of でしょう (right?); ~てください request form; そうやって (doing it that way); いいじゃん casual contraction of いいではないか

text: よくない
translation: That's not good.
grammar: よくない negative form of よい/いい (good)

text: 青 / 年どうやって選 / ばれたの / ねえテストとかあったの / 怖くなかった / 操縦席ってどんなの / いやあの / そういうの秘密で / 何 / だよ!
translation: How were you chosen? Hey, was there a test or something? Weren't you scared? What's the cockpit like? Well, um... that kind of thing is secret. What the heck!
grammar: passive form 選ばれた (was chosen); ~なかった past negative; って quotation/topic marker; そういうの (that kind of thing); で truncated sentence ending

text: あのロボット、 / なんて / 名前なの? / よく分かんないけど、みんながエヴァとか、そこを聞いて。 / 必殺技は?
translation: That robot, what's its name? I don't really know, but everyone calls it Eva or something. That's what you want to ask? What's its special attack?
grammar: 分かんない contraction of 分からない; けど (but); とか (or something, such as); そこを聞いて (that's what you're asking?)

text: あと、なんとかナイフって言って、振動が、超音波みたいに。 / すごいわ!学校 / の誇りよね!
translation: Also, there's something called a 'something knife', and the vibrations are like ultrasonic waves. That's amazing! You're the pride of our school!
grammar: って言う quotation particle (called); みたいに (like, similar to); わ feminine sentence ending particle; よね confirmation particle (right?)

text: で、ありますか? / ああ。
translation: Is that so? / Ah, yes.
grammar: であります formal/archaic copula; か question particle

text: 今日はこれまで。 / リース! / 9次第の方? / デン!
translation: That's all for today. / Rise! / On duty group 9? / Bow!
grammar: これまで (that's all for now); 起立 classroom command to stand; 礼 classroom command to bow

text: おっと、みんな最後くらいちゃんと! / すごいよね!
translation: Whoa, everyone, at least do it properly at the end! / That's so cool, isn't it!
grammar: くらい (at least); ちゃんと (properly); よね confirmation particle

text: すまんな、天光星。 / わしはお前を殴らないかん。 / 殴っとかな、気がすまへんなよ。
translation: Sorry, transfer student. I have to punch you. If I don't punch you, I won't feel satisfied.

vocabulary.meaning: to be satisfied, to feel better

grammar: ~ないかん Kansai dialect for ~なければならない (must); ~とかな = ~ておかないと (if don't do); 気がすまへん Kansai dialect for 気が済まない (won't be satisfied)

text: 悪いね。 / この間の騒ぎで、あいつの妹さん、怪我しちゃってさ。 / まあそういうことだから
translation: Sorry about this. In that incident the other day, his little sister got injured. Well, that's the situation, so...
grammar: ~しちゃう contraction of ~してしまう (ended up doing); さ sentence-ending particle for emphasis/explanation; まあ (well); そういうこと (that's the situation)

text: 僕だって乗りたくて乗ってるわけじゃないのに
translation: But it's not like I'm piloting it because I want to...

vocabulary.meaning: it's not that, it doesn't mean that

grammar: だって (even I/but); ~たくて (wanting to); ~ている progressive form; わけじゃない (it's not that); のに (even though) - expresses contradiction/frustration

text: 非常消臭、先行くから
translation: Emergency alert. I'm going ahead.
grammar: 先行く (go ahead/first); から explanatory particle (because/so)

text: ただいま、東海地方を中心とした関東中部の全域に / 特別非常事態宣言が発令されました / 速やかに指定のシェルターへ避難してください
translation: At this time, a special state of emergency has been declared across the entire Kanto-Chubu region centered on the Tokai area. Please promptly evacuate to your designated shelters.

vocabulary.reading: とくべつひじょうじたいせんげん

grammar: ~を中心とした (centered on); passive form 発令されました (was declared); ~てください request form

text: 繰り返しを伝えいたします
translation: We repeat this announcement.
grammar: 伝えいたします humble form of 伝えます (formal announcement language)

text: 中央ブロックおよび第1から第7巻区までの収容完了
translation: Sheltering of central block and districts 1 through 7 complete.
grammar: および (and, as well as) formal conjunction; ~から~まで (from...to...); noun+完了 (completion of noun)

text: 政府および関係各省への通達終了 / 現在対 / 空迎撃システム稼働率48%
translation: Notification to government and relevant ministries complete. Current anti-air interception system operational rate: 48%.
grammar: への particle (to/toward); noun+終了 (completion); 現在 at beginning indicates current status

text: 非戦闘員および民間人は? / すでに退避完了との報告が入っています
translation: What about non-combatants and civilians? Reports are coming in that evacuation is already complete.
grammar: は question particle; すでに (already); との quotation particle; ~ています progressive form (reports are coming in)

text: 小中学生は各クラス、住民の方々は各ブロックごとにお集まりください / まただ! / また文字だけ / なんか?
translation: Elementary and middle school students, please gather by class. Residents, please gather by block. It's happening again! Just text again. Something wrong?

vocabulary.reading: しょうちゅうがくせい

grammar: ~ごとに (per/by each); お~ください honorific request form; また (again); だけ (only)

text: 報道感性ってやつだよ / 僕ら民間人には見せてくれないんだ
translation: It's that thing called press control. They won't show it to us civilians.
grammar: ってやつ casual expression (that thing called); には emphatic particle; ~てくれない (won't do for us); んだ explanatory ending

text: こんなビッグイベントだっていうのに
translation: Even though it's such a big event...
grammar: だっていうのに (even though it's said to be; despite being) - expresses frustration or contradiction

text: 怒り司令の犬間に第4の使徒襲来 / 意外と早かったわね
translation: The Fourth Angel has appeared in the Ikari Commander's dogma / That was surprisingly fast
grammar: に + (noun) 襲来 = 'attack/arrival at (location)'; わね = feminine sentence ending particle expressing light assertion

text: 前は15年のブランク / 今回は / たったの3週 / 間ですからね / こっちの都合はお構いなしか
translation: Before there was a 15-year gap / This time / It's only 3 weeks / Our convenience doesn't matter to them, huh?

vocabulary.meaning: without regard for, paying no attention to

grammar: ですからね = explanatory 'because' with ね for confirmation; お構いなし = 'without regard/care for' + か for rhetorical question

text: 女性に嫌われるタイプね
translation: The type that women hate, huh?

vocabulary.meaning: to be disliked, to be hated (passive form)

grammar: に嫌われる = passive form 'to be disliked by'; タイプ = 'type/kind of person'; ね = sentence-ending particle for agreement

text: 税金の無駄遣いだな / 委員会から再びエヴァンゲリオンの出動要請が来ています / うるさい奴らね / 言われなくても出撃させるわよ
translation: What a waste of tax money / The committee is requesting Evangelion deployment again / They're so annoying / I'll deploy it even without being told
grammar: だな = casual masculine assertion; 言われなくても = 'even without being told' (negative conditional); させるわよ = causative + わよ (feminine assertive)

text: エンプスタートしました
translation: Startup has begun
grammar: しました = polite past tense of する; likely 'エンプ' is a technical term (possibly 'entry plug')

text: LCL 連火 圧着ロック解除
translation: LCL filled, pressure lock released

vocabulary.meaning: continuous fire (likely means 'filled' in this context)

grammar: Technical jargon for Eva startup sequence; noun phrases in succession indicating status updates

text: 父さんもいないのに / なんでまた乗ってんだろう
translation: Even though my father isn't here / Why am I getting in this thing again?
grammar: のに = 'even though' (contrasting expectation); なんで = 'why'; また = 'again'; 乗ってんだろう = contracted form of 乗っているんだろう (wondering why he's getting in)

text: 人になくなり手まで
translation: Even to the point of crying
grammar: になくなり = continuation form of 泣く with に (likely 泣かれて shortened); まで = 'even to the point of' (extent); audio quality issue may affect transcription

text: ねえちょっと二人で話があるんだけど / なんや / ちょっとな / しゃーないな
translation: Hey, the two of us have something to discuss / What is it? / Just for a bit / Can't be helped, huh
grammar: があるんだけど = 'there is... but' (soft approach); なんや = Kansai dialect 'what'; しゃーない = contraction of しょうがない

text: 委員長 / 何 / わしら二人便所や / もうちゃんと済ませときなさいよ / で、なんや? / 死ぬまでに一度だけでも見たいんだよ
translation: Class rep / What? / We're going to the bathroom / You should've gone already / So, what is it? / I want to see it at least once before I die
grammar: わしら = 'we' (masculine/regional); や = copula (Kansai); 済ませときなさい = ておく (prepare in advance) + command form; までに = 'by the time'; でも = 'even, at least'

text: 上のドンパチか? / 今度いつまた敵が来てくれるかどうかもわかんないし / ケンスケ、 / お前な / この時を逃しては、あるいは永久に
translation: The fighting up above? / We don't know when the enemy will come again / Kensuke, / You know / If we miss this chance, it might be forever
grammar: か = question particle; いつまた = 'when again'; てくれる = doing for us; かどうか = 'whether or not'; わかんない = contracted わからない; を逃しては = conditional 'if we miss'

text: 頼むよ、ロック外すの手伝ってくれ / 外に出たら死んでまうで? / ここにいたってわかんないよ / どうせ死ぬなら見てからがいい
translation: Please, help me unlock it / If you go outside you'll die, you know? / We don't know if we'll be safe even staying here / If we're going to die anyway, I'd rather see it first
grammar: てくれ = casual request; たら = conditional 'if'; 死んでまう = contraction of 死んでしまう (Kansai); たって = ても ('even if'); どうせ...なら = 'if we're going to... anyway'; てから = 'after doing'

text: アホ、何のためにNERVがおるんじゃ? / そのNERVの決戦兵器って何なんだよ?
translation: Idiot, what do you think NERV is here for? / What is NERV's decisive weapon?
grammar: 何のために = 'for what purpose'; おる = いる (Kansai dialect); んじゃ = のだ (explanatory, Kansai); って = quotative particle; なんだよ = 'what is it' (emphatic)

text: あの転校生のロボットだよ。この前もあいつが俺たちを守ったんだ。それをあんなふうに殴ったりして、それも二度も。あいつがロボットに乗らないなんて言い出したら、俺たち死ぬぞ。当時にはあいつの戦いを見守る義務があるんじゃないのか。しゃあないな。
translation: That transfer student's robot. Last time too, he protected us. And you went and punched him like that, twice even. If he says he won't get in the robot, we're dead. Don't you have a duty to watch over his battle? Can't be helped.

vocabulary.meaning: to watch over, to look after

grammar: だよ = assertive; この前も = 'last time too'; たりして = 'doing things like'; それも = 'moreover, what's more'; なんて = 'something like' (dismissive); 言い出したら = conditional 'if he starts saying'; ぞ = emphatic masculine; んじゃないのか = 'isn't it that...?' (rhetorical)

text: お前ほんま自分の欲望に素直なやっちゃな。
translation: You're really honest about your own desires, aren't you.
grammar: に素直 = 'honest/true to'; やっちゃ = やつは (contraction); な = sentence-ending particle (Kansai, light emphasis/confirmation)

text: シンジ君、出撃 / いいわね / はい
translation: Shinji, deploy / Okay? / Yes
grammar: いいわね = 'okay?' (feminine, seeking confirmation); はい = 'yes' (affirmative response)

text: よくって、敵のATフィールドを中和しつつ / パレットの一戦車 / 練習通り、大丈夫ね / はい / 発進!
translation: Alright, neutralize the enemy's AT Field while / With the rifle from the pallet / Just like practice, you'll be fine / Yes / Launch!
grammar: しつつ = 'while doing' (simultaneous action); 通り = 'just as, according to'; 大丈夫ね = 'it'll be okay, right?' (reassurance)

text: スゴイ! / これぞクローの甲斐もあったというもの! / あ!待ってました!
translation: Amazing! / This makes all that苦労 worthwhile! / Ah! I've been waiting for this!
grammar: これぞ = 'this is exactly' (emphatic); 甲斐もあった = 'was worthwhile'; というもの = 'indeed, truly'; 待ってました = past progressive 'have been waiting'

text: 出た
translation: It appeared
grammar: 出た = simple past tense 'appeared/came out'

text: はい
translation: Yes/Roger
grammar: Acknowledgment/affirmative response

text: バカ!爆炎で敵が見えない!
translation: Idiot! I can't see the enemy through the explosion!
grammar: で = particle indicating cause/reason; 見えない = potential negative 'cannot see'

text: なや、もうやられとるで / 大丈夫 / 予備のライフルを出すわ / 受け取って / シェンジ君 / シェンジ君 / あっちゃ
translation: Man, he's already getting beaten / It's okay / I'll send out a spare rifle / Receive it / Shinji / Shinji / Oh no

vocabulary.meaning: to be beaten, to be done in (passive)
to send out, to put out

grammar: やられとる = Kansai dialect for やられている 'is being beaten'; で = sentence-ending particle (Kansai); 出すわ = 'I'll send out' (feminine, decisive); 受け取って = te-form command; あっちゃ = exclamation of dismay

text: やっぱ殴られたのが聞いてるのかな / うる / さない / はい
translation: I guess getting punched is affecting him after all / Shut / up / Yes

vocabulary.meaning: as expected, after all (やっぱり contracted)
to be effective, to have an effect

grammar: 殴られた = passive past 'was punched'; のが = nominalizer; 効いてる = ている form 'is having an effect'; のかな = wondering tone; うるさない = うるさい split across dialogue

text: こっちに来る
translation: It's coming this way
grammar: に来る = directional 'coming toward'; present tense indicating ongoing action

text: シンジ君 / 大丈夫 / シンジ君 / ダメージは問題出し / 行きます
translation: Shinji / Are you okay? / Shinji / The damage isn't a problem / I'm going
grammar: 大丈夫 = question (rising intonation implied); 問題出し = likely 問題ない 'no problem'; 行きます = polite form 'I'm going' (determination)

text: シンジ君のクラスメイト / なぜこんなところに
translation: Shinji's classmates... Why are they in a place like this?
grammar: こんなところに uses the particle に to indicate location. The sentence ends abruptly, expressing surprise or concern.

text: なんで戦わんのよ / 僕らがここにいるから / 自由に動けないんだ / 初号機 活動限界まで あと3分28秒
translation: Why isn't he fighting? / Because we're here... / He can't move freely. / Unit-01, 3 minutes 28 seconds until activity limit.
grammar: 戦わんのよ is a colloquial negative form (戦わない). 動けないんだ uses the potential form 動ける in the negative, with んだ adding explanation. まであと indicates 'until' with time remaining.

text: シンジ そこの2人を操縦席
translation: Shinji, those two people into the cockpit...
grammar: The sentence is incomplete, likely cut off. を marks the direct object (the two people) and the speaker is giving instructions about moving them to the cockpit.

text: 2人を回収した後 一時退却 出直すわよ / 許可のない民間人を エントリープラグに寄せられると思っているの / 私が許可します / 越見行為よ カツラギッチ
translation: After recovering those two, we'll retreat temporarily. We'll regroup. / Do you think we can let unauthorized civilians into the entry plug? / I'll authorize it. / That's overstepping your authority, Misato.
grammar: した後 means 'after doing'. 寄せられると思っているの is a rhetorical question using potential form + と思う. わよ is a feminine sentence ending particle expressing assertion.

text: 初号機 活動限界まで あと3分 / エヴァは現行命令でホールド / その間にエントリープランが排出 / 急いで
translation: Unit-01, 3 minutes until activity limit. / Eva is on hold with current orders. / During that time, the entry plug will be ejected. / Hurry!
grammar: まであと indicates time remaining. でホールド uses で to indicate means/method. その間に uses に to mark the time frame when something occurs.

text: ここだフェリー / 乗って早く
translation: It's here, Toji! / Get in, quickly!
grammar: だ is the assertive copula. 乗って is the te-form of 乗る used as a command. The sentence structure emphasizes urgency.

text: なや店やないか / カメラ / カメラが
translation: Wait, this isn't the time! / The camera... / My camera!

vocabulary.meaning: isn't it (Kansai dialect for じゃないか)

grammar: やないか is Kansai dialect for じゃないか, expressing realization or emphasis. The が particle at the end indicates the speaker is about to explain something about the camera but trails off.

text: 神経剣道に異常発展 / 異物を2つもフラグに挿入したから
translation: Abnormal development in the neural connection! / It's because we inserted two foreign objects into the plug.
grammar: に異常発展 uses に to indicate where the abnormality is occurring. したから indicates reason/cause ('because we did').

text: 神経ファルスにノイズが混じっているんだわ
translation: There's noise mixing into the neural pulse.

vocabulary.meaning: to be mixed, to be mingled

grammar: ている indicates ongoing state. んだわ combines the explanatory んだ with the feminine particle わ, expressing realization.

text: 今よ! 後退して!
translation: Now! Retreat!
grammar: よ is an emphatic particle. して is the te-form used as a command, giving urgent instructions.

text: 回収ルートは3床4番 山の東 / 側に後退 / して / 逃げろユートルで! / 逃げちゃダメだ / 逃げちゃダメだ / プログレッシブナイフ 装備
translation: Recovery route is 3rd floor, number 4, to the east side of the mountain. / Retreat! / Run, Shinji! / I mustn't run away. / I mustn't run away. / Progressive knife, equipped.
grammar: 逃げろ is the imperative form of 逃げる. 逃げちゃダメだ uses ちゃ (contraction of ては) with ダメ to mean 'must not'. This is Shinji's famous repeated line.

text: シンジェク!命令を聞きなさい!退却よ! / シンジェク!
translation: Shinji! Listen to the order! Retreat! / Shinji!
grammar: なさい is a polite imperative form. を聞く means 'to listen to/obey'. よ is an emphatic particle expressing urgency.

text: あの馬鹿
translation: That idiot...
grammar: あの is a demonstrative adjective indicating distance. The sentence is a standalone exclamation expressing frustration or concern.

text: 第2章
translation: Chapter 2
grammar: 第 is a prefix used for ordinal numbers. This is a title card/section marker.

text: 初号機、発動限界まであと30秒 / 28、27、
translation: Unit-01, 30 seconds until activation limit. / 28, 27...
grammar: まであと indicates 'until' with remaining time. The countdown in Japanese follows the same pattern as English.
Continuation of the countdown. Japanese numbers are stated directly.

text: エヴァ初号機活動停止 / 目標は完全に沈黙しました
translation: Eva Unit-01 activity stopped. / The target has completely gone silent.
grammar: 活動停止 is a noun compound. しました is the polite past tense of する, indicating completed action.

text: お疲れ様でした
translation: Good work. / Thank you for your hard work.

vocabulary.meaning: thank you for your hard work, good job

grammar: お疲れ様でした is a set phrase used to acknowledge someone's effort or to say goodbye after work. でした is the polite past tense of です.

text: 別に心配っちゅうわけや / 当時は不器用なくせに / 五条だからね
translation: It's not like I'm worried or anything. / Even though Toji's clumsy... / He's stubborn, you know.
grammar: っちゅう is Kansai dialect for という. わけや is Kansai dialect for わけだ. くせに expresses contrast, meaning 'even though/despite'.

text: あの後別れ際にでも謝っておきゃ / 三日も悶々としなくて済んだのに / ほら / 転校生の電話番号 / 心配だったら / かけてみたら
translation: If he had apologized when they parted after that... / He wouldn't have had to agonize for three whole days. / Here. / The transfer student's phone number. / If you're worried... / Why don't you try calling?

vocabulary.meaning: time of parting, when saying goodbye
to be settled, to be finished

grammar: ておきゃ is a contraction of ておけば (if he had done). なくて済む means 'to not have to do'. のに expresses regret or contrast. みたら is a conditional suggestion meaning 'why don't you try'.

text: 自分の心を克服できず / ミサトからも逃げ出すシンジ / だが組 / 織は少年をあっさりと連れ戻す / そこに優しい言葉はなかった
translation: Unable to overcome his own heart, Shinji runs away from Misato as well. / But the organization easily brings the boy back. / There were no kind words there.
grammar: できず is the negative continuative form of できる. からも uses も to add 'also/even'. そこに indicates location 'there'. はなかった is past negative of ある.

text: 次回雨逃げ出した後 / この次もサービスサービス
translation: Next episode: After Running Away. / Next time, service, service!
grammar: した後 means 'after doing'. この次も uses も to mean 'also next time'. サービスサービス is repeated for emphasis, a catchphrase referring to fan service in the next episode preview.
